resources:
T-UI Version: Turn on GPS or network location Share Francesco Andreuzzi (Italy)
	-> Programmer 

Luke Winward (USA)
	-> Idea and design Refresh: apps, alias, music, contacts, rss feeds Thank you! T-UI started T-UI is running t-ui is having some issues. Please send to the developer your file crash.txt in the "t-ui" folder Lock the screen on double tap Translation not found
Exclude this notification Exclude app The notification service is't running
Invalid regex:
Theme not found Invalid theme You don't have an old theme Reverted to the previous theme
An unknown error has occurred This is a directory File not found
T-UI notification reader Unfortunately t-ui can't redirect you to the "Notification access" page of your system settings
First time with t-ui? Use the command "tutorial" or "help" You have to grant Storage permission You can use "apps -default_app" instead

Do you like my work?
If yes, rate t-ui on Play Store (cmd: $ rate) or offer me a coffee (cmd: $ donate). Thank you! Did you know? t-ui is on Twitter. You can have a look with the cmd "$ tui -twitter" Did you know? There's a Telegram group with many enthusiastic users, where you can discuss, share and chat with the developer.
Just use the cmd "$ tui -telegram" Did you know? Our official Google+ community is full of tips, experimental apks and discussions.
You can have a look with the cmd "$ tui -googlep" Did you read the tutorial? If you don't remember how to view it, the cmd is "$ tutorial" Did you know that you can easily switch your theme? Have a look at the cmd "$ theme" Did you know? You can create your custom theme and share it to other users. Have a look at the cmd "$ theme -create" Are you having any doubts about a command? Just use the cmd "$ help cmdName" Did you know? You can listen your music without launching other apps but t-ui. Have a look at the cmd "$ music" Did you know? t-ui 6.4 introduced App Groups, a feature that let's you customize your app suggestions, creating different categories.
You can get more details with the cmd "$ apps -tutorial" Did you know? You can see your notifications directly from t-ui.
If you're interested, have a look at the tutorial: "$ notifications -tutorial" Are you sick of clearing your screen? Have a look at the options "clear_after_cmds", "clear_after_seconds" and "maxlines" Do you want to use your wallpaper as t-ui background? Use the cmd: "$ config -set system_wallpaper true" Are you having doubts about any config option? Use the cmd "$ config -tutorial" and look for that option inside the table Did you know that t-ui supports aliases? It also supports parameterized aliases.
For more info, use the cmd "$ alias -tutorial" Do you want to make t-ui lighter? Use the cmd "$ config -set enable_music false" to disable the music player and save resources Did you know? You can exclude an unwanted notification long-clicking on it
You can disable this messages with the cmd "$ config -set show_hints false"
Application not found Activity not found App installed: App uninstalled:
Calling: t-ui will be closed in some seconds. Click the home button to restart it
You didn't grant the permission Waiting permission There was a problem while connecting to your device camera Invalid argument Less arguments than expected Invalid integer Nothing was found There was an XML problem with your file , t-ui will use default values.
Fix or delete the file to recover your options Error: Invalid color Group not found This group already exists Spaces are not allowed inside group names The notification service couldn't be started:
Invalid ID: no RSS feed found This ID has already been used Invalid ID This RSS feed hasn't been checked yet The time format couldn't be parsed Invalid publication date tag: Invalid entry tag: Invalid RSS: the file is empty:
Alias not found: There was a problem with your alias The name of your alias: is equal to its value. This may lead to bad behaviors, so it has been excluded. You should edit the name to use it is equal to the part of its value before the first space (i.e. aliasName=play ; aliasValue = play store). This may lead to crashes and freezes, so it has been excluded. You should edit the name to use it
Print the list of commands, or info about a command 

Usage: 
help [command] 

Example: 
$ help exit
Exit from tuixt Save changes You pressed the back key Saved Reading TUIXT This file is too big, consider opening it with an other text editor
WiFi active: Mobile Data active: Bluetooth active: Airplane mode active:
Playing: Player stopped Song not found enable_music is false!
Command not found.
Try to use "$ help" or "$ tutorial" Invalid option:
Flashlight ON Flashlight OFF Your device doesn't support flashlight
Battery: Mobile data: WiFi:
write your SMS or nothing to cancel Contact not found SMS not sent SMS sent
Toggle airplane mode -add [aliasName] [alias content] -> add a new alias 
-rm [aliasName] -> remove an existing alias 
-ls -> list your aliases 
-file -> open alias.xml
-ls -> list your apps 
-lsh -> list your hidden apps 
-show [appName] -> re-show an hidden app 
-hide [appName] -> hide an app 
-l [appName] -> show details about an app 
-ps [appName] -> show Google Play Store page for an app 
-st [appName] -> show Settings details for an app 
-default_app [index] [appName or most_used or null] -> set the default_app at the specified index 
-frc [appName] -> force t-ui to launch an app 
-file -> open apps.xml 
-reset [appName] -> reset the "launched_times" value of the given app to 0 
-mkgp [groupName] -> create a new group with the given name 
-rmgp [groupName] -> delete the group with the given name 
-gpcolor [groupName] [color] -> set the color for the given group 
-addtogp [groupName] [appName] -> add the given app to the given group 
-rmfromgp [groupName] [appName] -> remove the given app from the given group 
-lsgp [OPTIONAL: groupName] -> list your groups, or list the content of the given group
Toggle bluetooth Clear the screen Perform basic operations (+ - * / % ^ sqrt) 
Example: 

$ calc 4+2-5 
1 

$ calc 2 ^ (2*2) 
16 

$ calc sqrt25 
5
Call someone 

Usage: 
$ call [number] OR [contactName]
-set [option] [value] -> set the value of an option 
-append [option] [value] -> append the given string to the value of the selected option 
-file [file] -> open a config file (behavior.xml, ui.xml, theme.xml, ...) 
-get [option] -> get the value of an option 
-reset [option] -> reset the value of an option 
-info [option] -> request info about the given option 
-apply [file] -> move a file to the t-ui directory 
-tutorial -> open the tutorial page
Toggle mobile data There's nothing interesting there Offer a coffee to the developer (PayPal only) Toggle the flashlight Print the available commands, or info about a command 

Usage: 
$ help [command]
-next -> play the next song 
-previous -> play the previous song 
-play -> play/pause the player 
-stop -> stop the player 
-ls -> list your tracks 
-select [song] -> play the selected song 
-info -> get info about the current song 
-seekto [seconds] -> seek to the selected part of the current song Leave a feedback on the Play Store page Refresh apps, alias, music, contacts -add [ID] [regex] -> add a new regex with the given ID 
-rm [ID] -> remove the regex with the given ID 
-test [ID] [string] -> test the corresponding regex over the given string Restart t-ui and load modified values -gg [search this...] -> Google Search 
-ps [search this...] -> Google Play Store 
-file [search this...] -> Files 
-yt [search this...] -> YouTube 
-dd [search this...] -> DuckDuck Go
$ share [pathToFile]
Print the commands in /system/bin and /system/xbin Get info about battery charge, wifi status and mobile data -apply [theme] -> apply the selected theme (case sensitive). require internet connection. may take some seconds 
-view -> view the available themes 
-create -> create a new theme 
-old -> re-apply the theme that was replaced by the current one Print the current time with the given format 

Usage: 
$ time [index] (index means the index of the desired time_format Open the text editor. 

Usage: 
$ tuixt [textFile]
-rm -> uninstall t-ui 
-about -> show info about the developer and the current version 
-reset -> removes the t-ui folder and resets default settings (restart required) 
-twitter -> show t-ui Twitter page 
-googlep -> show the community on Google+ 
-telegram -> open the official Telegram group 
-folder -> print the path of the t-ui folder Open the tutorial page on GitHub Uninstall an application 

Usage: 
$ uninstall [appName]
Toggle wifi Send an SMS. 

Usage: 
$ sms [contactName] OR [number] 
$ [text]
Make your device vibrate. 

Usage: 
$ vibrate [milliseconds] 
$ vibrate [pattern: wait, vibrate, wait, vibrate, wait, ...] 

Example: 
$ vibrate 300 
$ vibrate 0,300,500,300 Emit a "beep". 

Usage: 
$ beep -inc [appName] -> include an application 
-exc [appName] -> exclude an application 
-color [color] [appName] -> set the color to be used for the application 
-format [ID] [appName] -> apply the format with the given ID to the corresponding application 
-add_filter [ID] [filter] -> create a new filter with the given ID 
-add_format [ID] [format] -> create a new format with the given ID 
-rm_filter [ID] -> delete the filter having the given ID 
-rm_format [ID] -> delete the format having the given ID 
-access -> show the system settings page dedicated to the Notification Access 
-file -> open notifications.xml 
-tutorial -> show the tutorial page Show your current location -ls -> list your contacts 
-l [contactName] -> show details about a contact 
-add -> create a new contact 
-edit [contactName] -> edit an existing contact 
-rm [contactName] -> remove a contact Close T-UI and reset the default launcher -add [ID] [update_time_in_seconds] [url] -> add a new RSS feed. t-ui will try to get new contents every [update_time_in_seconds] seconds 
-rm [ID] -> remove this RSS feed 
-ls -> list your RSS feeds 
-l [ID] -> show the whole content of the corresponding RSS feed 
-show [ID] [boolean] -> toggle the [show] property of the given saved RSS feed 
-update_time [ID] [update_time_in_seconds] -> set the update time of the corresponding RSS feed 
-format [ID] [format] -> set the format of the corresponding RSS feed ([format] can be both a string or the ID of an existing format) 
-color [ID] [color] -> set the base color of the corresponding RSS feed 
-wifi_only [ID] [boolean] -> if [boolean] is true, the corresponding feed will be updated only if your device is connected to a WiFi network 
-last_check [ID] -> show the last time t-ui checked this RSS feed 
-entry_tag [ID] -> set the base tag for every single entry (default: "item") 
-date_tag [ID] [tag] -> set the tag which holds info about the publication date (default: "pubDate") 
-add_command [ID] [IDs (comma separated)] [regex] [cmd] -> create a new regex command that will be applied on the RSS feeds corresponding to IDs 
-rm_command [ID] -> rm the corresponding regex command 
-frc [ID] -> update the corresponding RSS feed 
-info [ID] -> show info about the corresponding RSS feed settings 
-include_if_matches [ID] [regex] -> if the given regex matches on an RSS feed item, it will be shown ([regex] can be both a string or the ID of a regex saved inside regex.xml) 
-exclude_if_matches [ID] [regex] -> if the given regex matches on an RSS feed item, it won't be shown ([regex] can be both a string or the ID of a regex saved inside regex.xml) 
-add_format [ID] [format] -> create a new format that you will be able to use for more than one RSS feed 
-rm_format [ID] [format] -> remove an existing format 
-file -> open the file rss.xml
Interrupt the current shell process and create a new one Open a file 
Usage: 
$ open [pathToFile]
